DataElement.preferredName: HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor Fulfill Low Density Lipoprotein Criterion Requirement Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the requirement for administration of or increase in dosage of statins to meet low density lipoprotein (LDL) protocol goals.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor Fulfill Low Density Lipoprotein Criterion Requirement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Compounds that inhibit HMG-CoA reductases. They have been shown to directly lower cholesterol synthesis._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of._Low-density lipoprotein (LDL) is a lipoprotein that carries cholesterol around the body, for use by various cells.  LDL transports cholesterol to the arteries and increased levels are associated with atherosclerosis, and thus myocardial infarctions and strokes. This is why cholesterol inside LDL lipoproteins is called bad cholesterol. (from Wikipedia)_Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated._Requirement; something that is necessary.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Compounds that inhibit HMG-CoA reductases. They have been shown to directly lower cholesterol synthesis.

Concepts.definition: Any substance that inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, a key enzyme in cholesterol synthesis. Inhibition of HMG-CoA reductase acts to lower plasma cholesterol and lipoprotein levels.

Property.preferredName: Fulfill Low Density Lipoprotein Criterion Requirement
Property.preferredDefinition: Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.:Low-density lipoprotein (LDL) is a lipoprotein that carries cholesterol around the body, for use by various cells.  LDL transports cholesterol to the arteries and increased levels are associated with atherosclerosis, and thus myocardial infarctions and strokes. This is why cholesterol inside LDL lipoproteins is called bad cholesterol. (from Wikipedia):Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.:Requirement; something that is necessary.

Concepts.definition: Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

A lipoprotein that carries cholesterol around the body, for use by various cells.  LDL transports cholesterol to the arteries and increased levels are associated with atherosclerosis, and thus myocardial infarctions and strokes. This is why cholesterol inside LDL lipoproteins is called bad cholesterol.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
